TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit RegionData extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Encapsulates the data that makes up a object. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example is designed for use with Windows Forms, and it requires <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>`e`, which is a parameter of the `Paint` event handler. The code performs the following actions:
- Creates a rectangle and draw its to the screen in black.
- Creates a region using the rectangle.
- Gets the RegionData.
- Draws the region data (an array of bytes) to the screen, by using the DisplayRegionData helper function.
[!code-cs[System.Drawing.ClassicRegionExamples#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.drawing.drawing_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.ClassicRegionExamples#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.drawing.drawing_0_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Drawing.ClassicRegionExamples#6](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.drawing.drawing_0_1.cpp)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an array of bytes that specify the object.
Docs.value: An array of bytes that specify the object.

remarks.format:
## Examples
- The following example is designed for use with Windows Forms, and it requires <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>`e`, which is a parameter of the `Paint` event handler. The code example demonstrates how to use the Data from one <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.RegionData> object to set the Data for another <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.RegionData>.
[!code-cs[System.Drawing.MiscExamples#13](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.drawing.drawing_0_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Drawing.MiscExamples#13](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.drawing.drawing_0_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.MiscExamples#13](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.drawing.drawing_0_1.vb)]
